Lee  Bobst Library at New York University  70 Washington Square South, Mezzanine  New York, NY 10012  Phone: (212) 998-2633  E-mail: andrew.lee@nyu.edu                            NYU Links               Library's Collection Development Policy For History    Newspaper Backfiles    European newspapers at Bobst    Microform Sets in European History    Department of History Website                             Related Subject Guides               Research Guides:        Modern European History     British Parliamentary Papers     News and Events -- Historical     United Nations Resources     Finding 18th and 19th Century Periodical    Articles and Literature              Related Subject Guides        United States/North American History     World History     Medieval and Renaissance    Studies     Contemporary European    Studies     Women's Studies     Anthropology, Ethnic,    and Cultural Studies                                   Research Assistance            Tutorial:      Getting Started with Historical Research       Finding Books in BobCat:    BobCat can be searched for books and other materials in history with a subject search (s= ).  Generally, subject headings for books in history follow a specific pattern:   Place name -- Subdivision -- Time period .      Place names can be names of countries, regions or cities.  Subdivisions , as listed below in the examples, are standard and can be used with various place names. They describe the particular emphasis of the book.  Time period refers to the years covered by the book; time period designations vary according to place.     The following examples illustrate possible subject searches for the history of 19-century Great Britain:                Place Name      Subdivision      Time Period              s = Great Britain          History --     History --     Intellectual life --     Social conditions --     Economic conditions --     Politics and government --     Foreign relations --              19th century     Victoria, 1837-1901     19th century     19th century     1760-1860     19th century     1800-1837                 You can find information on all Western European countries by following this general pattern.     Also find information on interdisciplinary subjects with the alternate pattern:                Subject      Place Name      Subdivision      Time Period                  s = Women --     s = Middle classes --              France --     England --              History --     History --              19th century     19th century                 For more information, consult the Library of Congress Subject Headings , a 4-volume set which contains the subject headings used in BobCat and other library catalogs. Look under the place name or subject to see the appropriate subdivisions and time periods. Copies of LCSH are in all reference centers. Guide to Historical Literature. New York: Oxford University Press, 1995. 3rd ed. 2 volumes.    Bobst REF1 Z6201 .A55 1995   An annotated guide to scholarly works in history for all periods and areas of the world, compiled by specialists in the field.  Each of the 48 sections provides an introductory essay and extensive list of recommended books and articles for a specific country or region.  Coverage is concentrated on works published since 1963. Author and subject indexes.  For earlier works see Bibliography of Modern History , ed. by John Roach, Cambridge University Press, 1968 or the previous edition of the AHA's Guide to Historical Literature , published in 1961.         Reference Sources in History: An Introductory Guide , ed. by Ronald H. Fritze, Brian E. Coutts and Louis A. Vyhnanek. Santa Barbara, CA: ABC-CLIO, 1990.    Bobst REF1 Z6201 .F72 1990   This volume surveys all types of reference materials useful to historians, including bibliographies, periodical guides and indexes, newspapers, statistical sources, government publications, and biographical sources.  The emphasis is on English-language titles in the fields of American and European history.         Bibliography of European Economic and Social History , compiled by Derek H. Aldcroft and Richard Rodger. 2nd ed. Manchester, Eng: Manchester University Press, 1992.    Bobst REF1 Z7165 .E8 A4 1993   A useful compilation of articles and books on Europe, including Turkey and the Soviet Union, covering the period 1700 through 1939. Topics emphasized include labor, urban and rural history, transportation, population and migration, banking and commerce, and historiography.         Women in Western European History: A Select Chronological, Geographical and Topical Bibliography , ed. by Linda Frey, Marsha Frey and Joanne Schneider. 2 vols. plus supplement. Westport, CT: Greenwood Press, 1982-1984.    Bobst REF1 Z7961. F74 1982   This lengthy bibliography was one of the first devoted to women's history. The entries are for books only, arranged by period, country/region and then subject.  Listings include books in English and Western European languages and are not annotated. The second volume covers the 19th and 20th centuries.         The Foreign Affairs 50-year Bibliography, 1920-1970 . Ed. by Byron Dexter. New York: published for the Council on Foreign Relations by R.R. Bowker, 1972.    Bobst REF1 Z6461 .F62          Foreign Affairs Bibliography, 1962-1971 . Ed. by Janis A. Kreslins. New York : Published for the Council on Foreign Relations by R. R. Bowker Co., 1976.    Bobst REF1 Z6461 .K73   Entries in these volumes contain extensive descriptions summarizing the argument and importance for historical study. Subjects covered are history, diplomacy, and political and economic affairs.  An appendix lists important collections of government documents published since the 1920s: official histories of the World Wars, lists of treaties, and diplomatic records.                 General Narrative Histories         New Cambridge Modern History. Cambridge, Eng: Cambridge University Press, 1957-1979. 14 vols.    Bobst REF1 D208 .N4 & Bobst Stacks D208. N4   The standard survey of Western history from the Renaissance to World War II.  According to the general introduction, European "civilisation is to be treated in all its aspects, political, economic, social, 'cultural' and religious."  Does not include bibliographies.         Cambridge Economic History of Europe . Ed. by M.M. Postan and H.J. Habakkuk. Cambridge, Eng.: The University Press, 1966-1989. 8 vols.    Bobst REF1 & REF6 HC240 .C3 & Bobst Stacks HC240 .C3         Pounds, Norman J. G. An Historical Geography of Europe . Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 1990.    Bobst Stacks D21.5 .P62 1990   Surveys change in the fields of agriculture, manufacturing and industry, demographics, urbanism and trade.                 Dictionaries and Encyclopedias         Encyclopedia of European Social History From 1350 to 2000 . Ed. by Peter N. Stearns. Detroit: Scribner's, 2001. 6 vols.    Bobst REF1 HN373 .E63 2001   Articles are grouped in 23 sections, including a section on Methodologies, all with extensive bibliographies.  The sixth volume contains biographies. T69 1994   Alphabetically arranged; primarily a dictionary of political and economic history, with entries for persons, movements, events, etc.         Encyclopedia Britannica    Bobst REF1 AE5 .E5    Electronic Access                          Indexes             All databases with electronic availability are accessible from off campus, via the library's website. Go to the alphabetical list of databases at http://library.nyu.edu/collections/find_articles_title.html  and locate the database you'd like to search by title. When you click on "connect," you'll be prompted to enter your NYU Net ID and password.            Historical Abstracts . 1954-present   A searchable index to European and world history from 1450 to the present, searchable by author, subject and keyword. Covers about 2000 historical journals published in 50 languages; however, it is possible to limit searches to articles in English. Includes book reviews.    Electronic Access          Proquest . Coverage Varies   A multidisciplinary database that indexes newspapers, general interest magazines, and academic journals. A good source for book reviews.    Electronic Access          Wilson Omni . 1994-present   Contains indexed and abstracted articles from periodicals, all with ASCII full text online. The database is comprised of selected   records from the following H.W. Wilson databases: Readers' Guide Abstracts, Social Sciences Abstracts, Humanities Abstracts, General Science Abstracts   and Wilson Business Abstracts.(Note that each periodical can begin on a different month and year.)  Limited for History, but Articles are all Full-Text    Electronic Access       British Humanities Index. 1962-present    Bobst REF1 AI3. B8   An annual index, arranged by author and subject. Includes references to about a dozen journals not included in the indexes  above, largely on the history of Ireland and Great Britain. Most journals covered are available in Bobst.                               Statistics                 Mitchell, B.R. International Historical Statistics: Europe, 1750-2000. 5th ed. Bobst REF1 D395 .C59 1997   Primarily a series of chapters on important themes and topics: Population; European Diplomacy, 1871- 1914; Rise of European Feminism, etc.  Also includes a biographical section and a guide to further reading.        Cook, Chris, and John Stevenson, eds. Longman Handbook of Modern European History, 1763-1997. New York: Longman, 1998.    Bobst REF1 D299. C627 1998   A compilation of historical facts and figures organized into seven sections, including chronologies of political events, brief biographies, lists of principal rulers and ministers, tables of economic and social statistics, and a selective bibliography.        Pearson, Raymond, ed. The Longman Companion to European Nationalism, 1789-1920 . London ; New York : Longman, 1994.    Bobst REF1 D359.7 .P43 1994   A brief, but solid overview, with statistical tables, biographies, a glossary, and select bibliography organized geographically.        Williams, Neville. Chronology of the Modern World, 1763 to 1992. 2nd ed. NY: Simon & Schuster, 1994    Bobst REF1 D209 .W59 1994b   For each calendar year, a two-page listing of significant events. NY: Bowker, 1977. 3 vols.    Bobst REF1 D11.5 .R67 1977   Detailed listings of heads of state, cabinet officers, and rulers from the earliest times to 1975. Bobst Stacks D5 .K4   Extracts and abridgements of longer documents, with citations to complete sources.         European Women: a documentary history, 1789-1945 , edited by Eleanor S. Lee  Bobst Library at New York University  70 Washington Square South, Mezzanine  New York, NY 10012  Phone: (212) 998-2633  E-mail: andrew.lee@nyu.edu                            NYU Links               Library's Collection Development Policy For History    Newspaper Backfiles    European newspapers at Bobst    Microform Sets in European History    Department of History Website                             Related Subject Guides               Research Guides:        Modern European History     British Parliamentary Papers     News and Events -- Historical     United Nations Resources     Finding 18th and 19th Century Periodical    Articles and Literature              Related Subject Guides        United States/North American History     World History     Medieval and Renaissance    Studies     Contemporary European    Studies     Women's Studies     Anthropology, Ethnic,    and Cultural Studies                                   Research Assistance            Tutorial:      Getting Started with Historical Research       Finding Books in BobCat:    BobCat can be searched for books and other materials in history with a subject search (s= ).  Generally, subject headings for books in history follow a specific pattern:   Place name -- Subdivision -- Time period .      Place names can be names of countries, regions or cities.  Subdivisions , as listed below in the examples, are standard and can be used with various place names. They describe the particular emphasis of the book.  Time period refers to the years covered by the book; time period designations vary according to place.     The following examples illustrate possible subject searches for the history of 19-century Great Britain:                Place Name      Subdivision      Time Period              s = Great Britain          History --     History --     Intellectual life --     Social conditions --     Economic conditions --     Politics and government --     Foreign relations --              19th century     Victoria, 1837-1901     19th century     19th century     1760-1860     19th century     1800-1837                 You can find information on all Western European countries by following this general pattern.     Also find information on interdisciplinary subjects with the alternate pattern:                Subject      Place Name      Subdivision      Time Period                  s = Women --     s = Middle classes --              France --     England --              History --     History --              19th century     19th century                 For more information, consult the Library of Congress Subject Headings , a 4-volume set which contains the subject headings used in BobCat and other library catalogs. Look under the place name or subject to see the appropriate subdivisions and time periods. Copies of LCSH are in all reference centers.
